subject: Cybersecurity
title: Election Interference: Hacking Democracy
description: Learn Election Interference: Hacking Democracy in one minute.

hook.text: Russia didn't need to change a single vote in 2016. They just needed to change how people think about voting.

buildup.text: The 2016 U.S. election saw hacked DNC emails leaked at strategic moments, combined with targeted social media campaigns.

discovery.text: Russia scanned election systems in all 50 states. Even without changing votes, the perception of vulnerability.

twist.text: Election interference doesn't require changing results. Undermining confidence in the process is equally effective.

climax.text: Now every election faces the question: was this result legitimate? That doubt is itself the weapon.

punchline.text: You don't have to hack the vote. Just make people doubt it.

quiz.question: How does election interference work even without changing votes?
options: It undermines public confidence in election results
